text.0: the car which indra thou for service of the gods though it be far away o swift one bringest near which blameless one thou bringest near.
text.1: place swiftly nigh us for our help be it thy will that it be strong.
text.2: blameless and active hear this speech of orderers this speech of us like orderers.
text.3: hear indra thou whom men in every fight must call to show thy strength for cry of battle with the men with men of war for victory.
text.4: he who with heroes wins the light who with the singers gains the prize.
text.5: him the rich seek to gain even as a swift strong steed even as a courser fleet and strong.
text.6: thou mighty pourest forth the hide that holds the rain thou keepest far away hero the wicked man thou shuttest out the wicked man.
text.7: indra to thee i sing to dyaus to rudra glorious in himself.
text.8: to mitra varuṇa i sing a farfamed hymn to the kind god a farfamed hymn.
text.9: we wish our indra here that he may further you the friend beloved of all the very strong ally in wars the very strong ally.
text.10: in all encounters strengthen thou our prayer to be a help to us.
text.11: no enemywhom thou smitest downsubdueth thee no enemy whom thou smitest down.
text.12: bow down the overweening pride of every foe with succour like to kindlingwood in fiercest flame with mighty succour mighty one.
text.13: guide us thou hero as of old so art thou counted blameless still.
text.14: thou drivest as a priest all sins of man away as priest in person seeking us.
text.15: this may i utter to the present somadrop which meet to be invoked with power awakes the prayer awakes the demonslaying prayer.
text.16: may he himself with darts of death drive far from us the scorners hate.
text.17: far let him flee away who speaketh wickedness and vanish like a mote of dust.
text.18: by thoughtful invocation this may we obtain obtain great wealth o wealthy one with hero sons wealth that is sweet with hero sons.
text.19: him who is wroth we pacify with sacred food and eulogies.
text.20: indra the holy with our calls inspired and true the holy one with calls inspired.
text.21: on for your good and ours come indra with the aid of his own lordliness to drive the wicked hence to rend the evilhearted ones.
text.22: the weapon which devouring fiends cast at us shall destroy themselves.
text.23: struck down it shall not reach the mark hurled forth the firebrand shall not strike.
text.24: with riches in abundance indra come to us come by an unobstructed path come by a path from demons free.
text.25: be with us when we stray afar be with us when our home is nigh.
text.26: protect us with thy help both near and far away protect us ever with thy help.
text.27: thou art our own o indra with victorious wealth let might accompany thee the strong to give us aid like mitra to give mighty aid.
text.28: o strongest saviour helper thou immortal of each warriors car.
text.29: hurt thou another and not us o thunderarmed one who would hurt o thunderarmed.
text.30: save us from injury thou who art well extolled ever the warderoff art thou of wicked ones even as a god of wicked ones.
text.31: thou slayer of the evil fiend saviour of singer such as i.
text.32: good lord the father made thee slayer of the fiends made thee good lord to slay the fiends.
